info.title: DQ on Demand
info.description:
DQ on Demand is a Data Quality as a Service (DQaaS) Data Quality Improvement Platform that is designed to make the task of data management simpler.

 DQ on Demand is for those who are not prepared to accept the high cost of low-quality data, are frustrated with differing levels of quality, conflicting rules and levels of and data governance.

Billing is transactional, i.e. each request will consume credits, which can be spent on any of the available services.

LetterCategories.description: Categories letters by type? (Categories: UpperCaseVowel = V, LowerCaseVowel = v, UpperCaseConsonant = C, LowerCaseConsonant = c)

Exclude.description: Exclude the following types of letters from the pattern?

Collapse.description: Collapse the following types of letters in the pattern?

Collapse.description: Collapse multiple Non Printing characters into a single character?

get.description:

Note: Usage statistics update every 24 hours at Midnight UTC Time.

status.description: The HTTP Status code of the response.

message.description: A message describing the request status.

scheme.description: The Protocol used in the URL. I.E. HTTP, HTTPS, etc.

hostNameType.description: The type of the host name specified in the URL.

pathAndQuery.description: The Path and Query parameters used. I.E. `http://www.example.com/Path` would return `/Path`

post.description: Score records by choosing from a large set of record scoring options; customize your group weightings, score misaligned data and select from various data specific scoring rules.

IsDatum.description: Is this record the Datum / Master record. I.E. the record you will compare others against.

UniqueId.description: The RecordId so you can identify it in the output list.

RecordSource.description: Name of the source this record came from so you can identify it in the output list.

GroupFields.description: List of Groups to be scored (Groups will be scored against other groups with the same Name). Note: Every Record must have the same number of Entries in the GroupFields Array.

Settings.description: Scoring settings to be applied to the group.

ScoringType.description: `IntraScore`: Used for groups containing data from a single field. `InterScore`: Used for groups containing data from multiple fields. I.E.Email1 vs Email2 vs Email3.

ScoreMethod.description: What type of scoring should be performed?

ComparisonAlgorithm.description: Which algorithm would you like to use? Note: Our preferred algorithm is `JaroWinkler`

IsNullToNullScored.description: When performing the comparison should an empty value vs another empty value be considered a match or not?

IsNullToValueScored.description: When performing the comparison should an empty value vs a populated value be considered a match or not?

IsCaseSensitiveScore.description: Should casing be considered when performing the comparison?

AlphaSequenceParameter.description: Should any alphabetical sorting be applied to your data? This helps to minimize the effect of misaligned data.

IsReplaceDoubleSpaceWithSingle.description: Should two space characters be concatenated to a single space character?
IsReplaceDoubleSpaceWithSingle.x-ms-summary: Replace Double Space With Single Space?

IsRemoveAllWhiteSpaces.description: Should all whitespace characters be removed from the input? (Space, Non breaking Space, Tab, etc)

IsTrimString.description: Should whitespace at the start and end of the input be removed?

IsIncludePunctuation.description: Should Punctuation be included when performing the comparison?

IsIncludeSymbols.description: Should Symbols be included when performing the comparison?

IsIncludeNonPrinting.description: Should Non-Printing characters be included when performing the comparison?

IsIncludeNumbers.description: Should Numbers be included when performing the comparison?

IsIncludeAlphaChars.description: Should Letters be included when performing the comparison?

IsWeightingFactorUsed.description: Should a weighting be applied to the result of the group? Note: Weighting value is set using the `Weighting` property.

IsIncludeOriginalDataForScoring.description: Should the original input be used in the score calculation? (I.E.before any characters have been excluded).

IncludeTokenForScoring.description: Should the Tokenized value be used in the score calculation?

IncludeTransformedDataForScoring.description: Should the Transformed value be used in the score calculation? (I.E.after characters have been excluded).

AutoPopulateEmptyTransformed.description: Auto populate the `GroupValues.TransformedValue` property using `GroupValues.Value` if `GroupValues.TransformedValue` is null?

AutoPopulateEmptyToken.description: Auto populate the `GroupValues.Token` property using `GroupValues.TransformedValue` (after transformation) if `GroupValues.Token` is null?

Weighting.description: Must be a number between -100 and 100. (100 = no change to the result) (A Negative weighting would be used to lower the overall score if values in that group match)

PostalCodeNChars.description: How many characters should be taken from the postal code? Note: Only applies when ScoreMethod is one of: PostalCodeLeftN, PostalCodeRightN.

PositiveValidRange.description: How far above can the number go and still be valid. I.E.5 vs 10 is a positive range of 5, but 5 vs 4 is a negative range of 1. Note: Only applies when scoreMethod is one of: PostalCodeAsZip, AddressLine1WholeInput, AddressLine1Premise.

NegativeValidRange.description: How far below can the number go and still be valid. I.E.5 vs 10 is a positive range of 5, but 5 vs 4 is a negative range of 1. Note: Only applies when scoreMethod is one of: PostalCodeAsZip, AddressLine1WholeInput, AddressLine1Premise.

DateFormat.description: What format are your Date values in?

InterScoreSettings.description: Additional config for when using scoringType = InterScore.

InterScoreMethodType.description: What type of multi field comparison should be used?

ThresholdValue.description: Similarity Threshold for what counts as a match. (Between 0 and 100, Default = 100)

Values.description: List of Values to compare within the group.

TransformedValue.description: The Transformed field value. (I.E. After whitespace, numbers, etc have been removed).

Token.description: A Tokenized representation of the data.

status.description: The HTTP Status code of the response.

message.description: A message describing the request status.

datumRecordSource.description: The `RecordSource` value supplied on the Input Datum record.

datumUniqueId.description: The `UniqueId` value supplied on the Input Datum record.

secondaryRecordSource.description: The `RecordSource` value supplied on the Input Secondary record.

secondaryUniqueId.description: The `UniqueId` value supplied on the Input Secondary record.

groupOutput.description: List of scoring results for each field group supplied.

groupPercentageScore.description: The Similarity Score of the group.

warnings.description: List of Warnings (if any) for the group.

get.description: Transform data (Abbreviate, Elaborate, Exclude or Normalize) in 5 spoken languages. Choose from 11 different transformation libraries including: Business, Countries, First Names and Addressing... e.g. Abbreviate country transform (United Kingdom to UK).

post.description: Perform multiple transformations in a single request. For Example; Elaborate Numbers and Abbreviate Addresses.

EntityType.description: The Category to use for transforming.

OperationType.description: The type of transformation to perform.

Language.description: The spoken language that the value is in.

UID.description: The record identifier which will be echoed back to you.

get.description: Truly confirm if your email is authentic and will deliver. \n\nNote: `Betterfy` only support business email addresses and will not check free email providers such as `hotmail`, `gmail`, etc.

status.description: The HTTP Status code of the response.

message.description: A message describing the request status.

domainPart.description: The Domain part of the Email. I.E.`Bob.Smith@Example.com` -> `Example.com`

isCorporate.description: Is the supplied email a business email or from a free email provider (`hotmail`, `gmail`, etc)

isDisposable.description: Is the supplied email address a disposable mailbox.

isRoleBased.description: Is the Local part of the email role based (`support`, `sales`, `marketing`, etc)

localPart.description: The Local part of the Email. I.E.`Bob.Smith@Example.com` -> `Bob.Smith`

additionalInfo.description: Dictionary of additional fields returned by the provider.

get.description: Truly confirm if your phonenumber is authentic and will dial.

parameters.name: CountryIdentifier
parameters.description: A Country Identifier (GB, GBR, United Kingdom, etc). Note: Only required if the provided phone number is not in international format. (starting with +)

status.description: The HTTP Status code of the response.

message.description: A message describing the request status.

additionalInfo.description: Dictionary of additional fields returned by the provider.

get.description: Check if a value is comprised only of upper case letters.
Check if a value is comprised only of lower case letters.
Check if a value is comprised only of upper case and lower case letters.
Check if a value is comprised of letters and/or numbers.
Check if a value is comprised only of numbers.
Check if a value is a valid ISO4217 code. I.E. GBP, USD, EUR, etc.
Check if a value is a valid ISO3166 Alpha-2 country code. I.E.GBP, UK, FR, ES, etc.
Check if a value is a valid ISO3166 Alpha-3 country code. I.E.GBR, USA, FRA, etc.
Remove the specified string from the start of a value.

parameters.name: LeaveOneAtStart
parameters.description: Leave one occurrence at the start?

get.description: Remove the specified character type from the input.

parameters.name: characterType
parameters.description: The type of characters to remove.

get.description: Remove all single characters from the input I.E. `This is a test` -> `This is test`
Check and replace repeated neighbouring characters.
Check the end of the supplied input for a value, if found replace the found value with the specified replacement value.
Check the start of the supplied input for a value, if found replace the found value with the specified replacement value.
Convert a string value into its Binary equivalent.
This will convert a Binary value into its string equivalent.
Convert a string value into its Hex equivalent.
Convert a Hex input into its string equivalent.
Reverse a string value. I.E. `example` -> `elpmaxe`
Convert whitespace within a string into a single space.
Convert letters into numbers using a phone keypad. I.E. `1-800-flowers` -> `1-800-3569377`

The word `Silly` would be reduced to `Sily` if the maximum repeat was set to 1, as the `l` is repeated once. However, The word `Silly` would remain unchanged if the maximum repeat was set to 2, as the `l` is not repeated more than once. Inversely, The word `Global` would remain the same regardless of the maximum repeat as the `l` is repeated, but not consecutively.

parameters.name: maximumRepeat
parameters.description: Maximum Number of repeated characters allowed before collapsing.

get.description: Check and replace repeated neighbouring characters of the same type. I.E.`Test$$` -> `Test$` Note: Both the $ and the  are counted as a symbol, but they are not the same character so did not get collapsed.

parameters.name: MaximumRepeat
parameters.description: Maximum Number of repeated characters allowed before collapsing.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The character type to check for.

get.description: Filter out rudimentary ENGLISH stop words E.G. a, about, after and many more.
This will replace all characters in the supplied input with the replacement character, except the ones you have specified to keep.

parameters.name: charactersToRetain
parameters.description: Concatenated list of characters to retain. I.E. to retain vowels use `aeiou`

get.description: Extract a given number of characters from the start or end of a string.

parameters.name: extractLength
parameters.description: The Number of characters to extract.

parameters.name: extractFrom
parameters.description: Where in the value should the extraction happen.

get.description: Extract a given number of words from the start or end of a string.

parameters.name: extractLength
parameters.description: The Number of words to extract.

parameters.name: extractFrom
parameters.description: Where in the value should the extraction happen.

get.description: Remove all HTML Tags from the Input.
Check if a value ends in with a specific string.
Check if a value starts with a specific string.

parameters.name: suffix
